alert.note: Alert for Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:23AM EST until December 20 at 3:16AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in New Jersey... Pompton River At Pompton Plains affecting Morris and Passaic Counties. For the Pompton River...including Pompton Plains...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pompton River at Pompton Plains. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The first flooding begins in the area of River Road and Harrison Street. At 16.0 feet, Residences on Pequannock Avenue along the river between Madison and Shady streets become surrounded by water. Businesses along Route 23 north begin to flood. At 17.0 feet, Pequannock Avenue at Roosevelt Street becomes impassable. Route 23 exit ramp at Alexander Avenue becomes impassable. At 18.0 feet, Pequannock Avenue at Shady Street becomes impassable and blocks Roosevelt and Shady Streets. Oakwood at Shady Street becomes impassable. The first evacuations begin. Flooding occurs on West View Road and the Lower Riverview community areas of Wayne. At 18.5 feet, Route 23, North and South, is impassable and closed. At 19.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs in low lying areas of Wayne, Pequannock and Pompton Lakes. At 20.0 feet, Village section of Pompton Plains begins to flood. At 21.0 feet, Flooding occurs across a large area from Jackson Avenue on the north and Riverside Drive on the south between the railroad tracks and the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EST Monday was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.3 feet on 03/07/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Pompton River Pompton Plains 16.0 18.7 Mon 10 a 18.6 14.8 20.1 1am 12/19 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
